purpose: Define the operational rules and expectations for running WyneOS in a controlled environment.

principles.stability: System behaviour must remain predictable across all operations.
principles.integrity: Critical files, manifests, and seals must not be altered outside controlled updates.
principles.traceability: All operations must be traceable through logs and audit trails.
principles.governance: All actions must comply with the active governance model.
principles.safety: Predictive and emergent behaviour cannot override governance or integrity controls.

updates.allowed: Minor and patch releases may be applied without altering system behaviour.
updates.restricted: Major updates require review of seals, manifests, and governance rules.
updates.prohibited: Any direct change to sealed files or audit logs.

restricted: Direct modification of engine output files

telemetry.requirement: Heartbeat, integrity, and sync telemetry must remain active.
telemetry.failureResponse: If telemetry becomes invalid, governance may enforce a safe mode.

governance.enforcement: Policy engine decisions override runtime operations.
governance.violations: Any breach triggers an enforced governance lock.

deployment.environment: Controlled internal deployment within WFSL and SAS-CIC systems.
requirements: Access to system registry and telemetry files
Integrity seals must be present and valid
